title: Calculate the Change in Enthalpy
text: Using the standard heats of formation for the reactants and products, calculate the standard enthalpy change, ΔH° , for the reaction. ΔH° $$=$$ ∑products ΔH_f° - ∑reactants ΔH_f° . Hint: Use the provided values.

title: Convert Free Energy Change to Joules
text: The given ΔG° is in $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$. Convert it to $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ by multiplying by $$1000$$.

title: Use Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: You can find ΔS° using the equation: ΔG° $$=$$ ΔH° - TΔS° . Solve for ΔS° .

title: Solve for Standard Entropy Change
text: Re-arrange the equation ΔG° $$=$$ ΔH° - TΔS° and solve for ΔS° . Substitute ΔG° $$=$$ $$-32890$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$, ΔH° $$=$$ $$-137150$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$, and T $$=$$ $$298$$ K into the equation: ΔS° $$=$$ (ΔH° - ΔG°)/T.
